page.title: 07HOUSING:Cont
page.content: in St.Benet's. The estates are compact to avoid loss of prime arable land and built around Stalham because of the relatively wide range of amenities found there. Equally important are the numbers of retired people who settle in the area and the provision made for the elderly and/or infirm at Portalfields, Robert Smith Court and Sydney House. The pattern of house-building is however, different in the rest of the D-Block. Here agriculture dominates and houses are few and far between- as in the widely dispersed parishes of Brumstead, East Ruston and Ingham. This also means that the amenities are far less concentrated than in Stalham, and less attractive to one-car families where the husband needs it during the day, leaving the wife as a prisoner in the home.
